Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the log I see activities related to different applications and windows Microsoft Word with windows like Quarterly_Report.docx and Document1.docx Google Chrome with Email - Inbox Adobe Acrobat with Report_Draft.pdf Microsoft Excel with Budget_2024.xlsx It seems like the user is working on multiple tasks possibly related to preparing a quarterly report handling emails reviewing a PDF and updating a budget spreadsheet

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me try to identify sequences of events that seem to belong together Starting from the beginning 2024-12-11T08:59:50.000Z FOCUS App=Microsoft Word Window=Quarterly_Report.docx 2024-12-11T09:00:00.000Z FOCUS App=Microsoft Word Window=Document1.docx 2024-12-11T09:00:30.000Z TYPING App=Microsoft Word Window=Document1.docx Keys=Draft intro paragraph Here the user focuses on Quarterly_Report.docx briefly then switches to Document1.docx and starts typing and saving It seems like the user is working on Document1.docx Then 2024-12-11T09:01:45.000Z SWITCH FromApp=Microsoft Word FromWindow=Document1.docx ToApp=Google Chrome ToWindow=Email - Inbox 2024-12-11T09:02:00.000Z CLICK App=Google Chrome Window=Email - Inbox Action=Open Email about Annual Meeting The user switches to Google Chrome opens an email scrolls replies types a message and sends the email This seems like a complete task of handling an email

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: One way to group events into cases is by the specific document or window they relate to For example All events related to Document1.docx could be one case Events related to Email - Inbox could be another case Events related to Report_Draft.pdf could be a separate case Events related to Budget_2024.xlsx could be another case Events related to Quarterly_Report.docx could be yet another case

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Wait but looking closer there might be a relationship between these tasks For example the user updates the budget and then inserts a reference to it in Document1.docx Similarly the user might be gathering information from the email and the PDF to include in the documents Alternatively perhaps all these activities are part of a larger process like preparing a quarterly report which involves updating the budget checking emails reviewing drafts and writing the report

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: However for process mining it is often useful to have cases that represent smaller coherent units of work If I make the entire log one case it might not reveal much about the process flow Let me try to group events by the specific window or document they relate to For Document1.docx Events 2 to 5 Focusing typing saving Event 19 Switching back to it Events 20 to 22 Typing saving closing

Name: Validation - PE
Text: This way each case corresponds to a specific document or window and the events are the actions taken on that document Let me try to group events by the window or document they relate to Document1.docx events 2 3 4 5 19 20 21 22 Email - Inbox events 6 7 8 9 10 11 Report_Draft.pdf events 12 13 14 Budget_2024.xlsx events 15 16 17 18 Quarterly_Report.docx events 1 23 24 25 26 This seems reasonable

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: However I need to be careful with the SWITCH events For example event 6 is switching from Document1.docx to Email - Inbox Should this be part of the Document1.docx case or the Email - Inbox case In process mining SWITCH events might be considered as transitions between cases but since each case is tied to a specific document perhaps it is better to include the SWITCH event in the case of the ToWindow since the user is switching to that window So maybe for each SWITCH event I can start a new case for the ToWindow and include the subsequent events until the next SWITCH

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Another idea since the user is switching between different applications and windows perhaps each sequence of events without switching to another window could be considered part of a case For example From event 2 to 5 working on Document1.docx Then switch to Email - Inbox from event 6 to 11 Then switch to Report_Draft.pdf from event 12 to 14 Then focus on Budget_2024.xlsx from event 15 to 18 Then switch back to Document1.docx from event 19 to 22 Then focus on Quarterly_Report.docx from event 23 to 26

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Now for the activity names I need to translate the raw actions into higher-level process steps For example instead of FOCUS TYPING SAVE etc I can use more meaningful names like Start Editing Edit Content Save Document etc Lets try to define standardized activity names First for each case the first event could be Start Working on Document and the last event could be Finish Working on Document especially if there is a CLOSE event For Document1.docx the events are FOCUS on Document1.docx TYPING Draft intro paragraph TYPING Additional details here SAVE Then later SWITCH to Document1.docx TYPING Inserting reference to budget SAVE CLOSE So I can map this to activities like Start Editing event 2 Edit Content events 3 4 Save Document event 5 Resume Editing event 19 Edit Content event 20 Save Document event 21 Finish Editing event 22

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: So perhaps for each window type I can define specific activities For Microsoft Word documents FOCUS or SWITCH to the document Start Editing Document TYPING Edit Content SAVE Save Document CLOSE Finish Editing Document Similarly for Excel FOCUS or SWITCH Start Editing Spreadsheet TYPING Edit Cells SAVE Save Spreadsheet For Email SWITCH to Email Start Email Task CLICK Open Email SCROLL Read Email CLICK Reply Start Reply TYPING Write Reply CLICK Send Send Reply For PDF SWITCH to PDF Start Reviewing PDF SCROLL Read PDF HIGHLIGHT Highlight Text
